fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Business and Industry, Taxation, Single market, External Relations, Digital economy and society
eu_initiatives:
Barclays aims to contribute to the debate between all stakeholders on the development of public policy on issues that directly affect the bank, and its customers and clients. It also aims to contribute on wider issues affecting economic prosperity or financial stability, where it has expertise to contribute.  
 
Areas of direct interest include banking and prudential files, markets files, retail payments, investment funds and wider non-financial services issues such as data protection, cyber and the broader digital agenda.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
Barclays is a member of the following associations and networks engaged in EU policy:  
Association for Financial Markets in Europe (AFME), Centre for European Policy Studies (CEPS),  
European Parliamentary Financial Services Forum, International Swaps and Derivatives Association (ISDA), International Capital Markets Association (ICMA),  
British Bankers’ Association (BBA),  
American Chamber of Commerce (Amcham),  
British Chamber of Commerce,  
Confederation of British industry (CBI),  
QED, Financial Future,  
TheCityUK,  
European Retail Financial Forum (ERFF),  
European Financial Services Roundtable (EFR)  
Eurofi.
goals__remit:
Barclays is an international consumer, corporate and investment bank, with core markets in the UK and the US. 
 
Barclays’ purpose is to help people achieve their ambitions – in the right way. With over 300 years of history and expertise in banking, Barclays moves, lends, invests and protects money for customers and clients worldwide.
